Logical Matchers
[Matcher Library]

Boolean logic composing multiple matchers. More...

 Calculates the logical conjunction of multiple matchers. More...

Detailed Description

Boolean logic composing multiple matchers.

Define Documentation

#define allOf (   match,
  ... 
)    HC_allOf(match, ##__VA_ARGS__)

Evaluates to YES only if all of the given matchers evaluate to YES.

Synonym for HC_allOf, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

Parameters:
match Comma-separated list of matchers - or values for equalTo matching - ending with nil.
See also:
HCAllOf
#define anyOf (   match,
  ... 
)    HC_anyOf(match, ##__VA_ARGS__)

Evaluates to YES if any of the given matchers evaluate to YES.

Synonym for HC_anyOf, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

Parameters:
match Comma-separated list of matchers - or values for equalTo matching - ending with nil.
See also:
HCAnyOf
#define anything (  )     HC_anything()

This matcher always evaluates to YES.

Synonym for HC_anything, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIsAnything
#define anythingWithDescription   HC_anythingWithDescription

anythingWithDescription(description) - This matcher always evaluates to YES.

Synonym for HC_anythingWithDescription, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

Parameters:
description A meaningful string used when describing itself.
See also:
HCIsAnything
#define isNot   HC_isNot

isNot(match) - Inverts the rule, or provides a shortcut to the frequently used isNot(equalTo(x)).

For example: 

assertThat(cheese, isNot(equalTo(smelly)))

vs. 

assertThat(cheese, isNot(smelly))

Synonym for HC_isNot, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIsNot

id<HCMatcher> HC_isNot ( id  match  ) 

Inverts the rule, or provides a shortcut to the frequently used isNot(equalTo(x)).

For example: 

assertThat(cheese, isNot(equalTo(smelly)))

vs. 

assertThat(cheese, isNot(smelly))

Synonym: isNot

See also:
HCIsNot
